Most Massachusetts immigrants are citizens

More than half of the immigrants in the state are naturalized citizens, earning the right to vote, run for political office, and apply for federal jobs.

Regardless of the availability of convicted cornerback Alfonzo Dennard, the Patriots needed to address their pass defense. The best way is by keeping Aqib Talib.
